explanation: The report is not correct. First, the expression-statement (void) url; appears in ahc_echo in the additional code, not in the MHD_digest_auth_check3 target function — so the allegation as applied to MHD_digest_auth_check3 is misplaced. Second, the (void)parameter; idiom is a well‑known, intentional no‑op used solely to suppress "unused parameter" compiler warnings. Although such a statement has no runtime effect (and so meets the formal textual definition of "an operation whose removal would not affect program behaviour"), in practice it is an annotation to document that the parameter is intentionally unused. MISRA analyses and tool configurations commonly recognise and accept this idiom (or an equivalent UNUSED macro or compiler attribute) rather than treating it as a harmful dead‑code defect. If your project policy requires stricter handling, replace the cast with an agreed UNUSED macro or remove the parameter name in the function prototype/definition, or configure the static checker to treat the idiom as an approved exception. Therefore the report claiming a Rule 2.2 violation is not correct for the shown code/function.
